Title: Managing Director
RoleDescription: Amivet is one of the UK's leading specialist providers of veterinary export health certificates and advice for the export of food and other products of animal origin. With a dedicated team of Official Veterinarians (OVs) and Certification Support Officers (CSOs) throughout the country and a central support team based at our Head Office in Sandiway, Cheshire.Since joining the IVC Evidensia group in June 2022, we have continued to build our reputation while benefiting from being part of a larger group. We are now looking for a dynamic and experienced Managing Director or CEO to drive our plans for expansion and diversification, leading our exceptional team towards continued growth and success.The Role As the Managing Director, you will be responsible for the overall strategic direction, growth, and operational performance of Amivet. This is a key leadership role where you will collaborate with the senior management team to shape the future of the company, ensuring it thrives in an evolving and competitive market. You will also play a critical role in maintaining a culture of trust, empowerment, and excellence across our team, with a focus on remote working.We support hybrid working and would ask for your time to be split between home and in-office at our HQ in Blakemere Village, Cheshire. The role will involve some travel to meet our clients, visit our sites and to attend trade shows across Europe Key Responsibilities:*Provide strategic advice to the Group to ensure an accurate view of market trends and future company growth.*Lead the development and execution of business strategies to achieve the goals set by the board and shareholders.*Oversee the creation and implementation of business plans, ensuring cost-effective operations and marketing activities.*Lead expansion efforts into new markets and sectors.*Ensure the security and compliance of the company’s digital business.*Provide leadership and management to ensure high standards of service to clients and staff, contributing to sustainable profitability.*Manage financial performance, including achieving EBITDA objectives and budget goals.*Ensure efficient use of resources and compliance with Group purchasing, procurement, and quality policies.*Foster  a positive culture by providing leadership, guidance, and development opportunities for staff.*Promote the business and ensure proper marketing and promotional efforts to protect the competitive position.*Maintain compliance with all relevant regulatory and legal requirements, including health and safety and veterinary codes of conduct.*Work collaboratively with senior managers to support the company’s success. What we're looking for*Proven experience managing an SME, with a demonstrated ability to lead organisational change.*A strategic mindset, with the ability to see the bigger picture and make key business decisions.*A successful track record of entering new markets, sector diversification, and achieving business growth.*Strong financial acumen and experience in managing budgets.*Excellent communication skills, capable of engaging a diverse range of stakeholders across different media.*A history of working within a highly regulated environment, including experience with tenders and contracts.*A leadership style that empowers teams, fosters trust, and promotes excellence in performance. Why Join Us: Amivet offers a collaborative and dynamic environment within a growing business backed by the resources of the IVC Evidensia group. This is a unique opportunity to lead an exceptional team, shape the strategic direction of the company, and drive its continued success in a competitive market. You will also benefit from being part of a larger, internationally recognised network with significant opportunities for personal and professional growth.If you are a visionary leader with a passion for growth, innovation, and team empowerment, we would love to hear from you. Title: Animal Care Assistant (FTC)
RoleDescription: We are hiring!We are looking to recruit a dedicated and enthusiastic Animal Care Assistant (ACA) to help in the smooth running of the clinic. The ideal candidate would be kind, caring, compassionate, outgoing and have a passion for animal welfare. About the roleThe role would be of particular interest for someone who is keen to pursue a career in Veterinary nursing. The role would primarily be based at the Overdale branch in Buxton but we occasionally help out at our partner practices. We are looking for someone who has some experience in animal handling and welfare, but onsite training will be provided when necessary. The successful applicant will be mentored by the nursing team until they are ready to work more independently, but help will always be given when needed. For the right candidate career progression within the team will be possible. Duties will include animal handling and restraint, inpatient care, general cleaning and maintenance, and peri-operative support for surgical cases. Occasional reception cover may be required, for which training would be provided. Rota and salaryThe role will be on a 12 month fixed term contract, with the prospect of extending after that time. This is a full time role working 37.5 hours over 5 days per week, with the clinic open between 8:00am – 7:00pm.   The salary for this role is £22,405 DOE plus benefits Want to know more about Overdale?Overdale Veterinary Centre is based in the picturesque spa town of Buxton, nestled in the Peak District. The clinic has a classical feel about it, with the ethos of providing a high standard of clinical care to our clients across the board.  We have 3 small animal consulting rooms (2 vet and 1 nurse), one dedicated operating theatre, an imaging suite (digital x-ray, ultrasound and endoscopy plus Dental x-ray arriving soon...), prep area with dental facilities and in house laboratory. We have separate cat and dog kennels.  Our team and cultureWe are currently a 4FT and 2PT vet team ranging from 1 year to 18 years of experience. We have small animal medicine certificate holders, with another in progress. This gives a wide breath of skills and experience which enables us to support and mentor new additions. We are a nurse training practice and have 3 FT & 4 PT qualified nurses, with several ECC certificate holders. On reception we have a dedicated team who manage the front of house. With the Peak District literally on your doorstep you can undertake a wide variety of outdoor pursuits in your leisure time, including rock climbing, cycling, angling and walking. Buxton also benefits from the Buxton Opera House which has a very good line up. If you are missing the big city then Manchester is only a short train ride away. There is a lot to do in Buxton and we are a very social practice and frequently have nights out, BBQs and weekend activities.  Our ideal candidateWe are looking for a kind caring & enthusiastic Animal Care assistant who has a passion for working with animals.
